data.title: Bachelor of Science in Aviation-Unmanned Aircraft Systems
data.meta_description: The Bachelor of Science in Aviation with a concentration in Uncrewed Aircraft Systems (UAS) is designed for students who would like to build a career in the new world of UAS Operations.  Courses will include a comprehensive general education curriculum, aviation department requirements, aviation core classes, and a concentration that will focus on not only flying the uncrewed aircraft, but also the skills to manage a full operation and utilize the data and imagery collected.
data.meta_site_name: College of Public Affairs and Community Service
data.text:
Concentration in UAS Operations: The concentration focuses not only on piloting unmanned aircraft but also on managing entire UAS operations. Key areas of study include:

a. UAS Flight Operations: Students learn the technical skills required to pilot and operate unmanned aircraft systems effectively. This involves hands-on training in flight planning, control systems, and flight execution.

b. Operation Management: Understanding the logistics, regulatory compliance, and safety protocols necessary to orchestrate a comprehensive UAS operation. This includes managing personnel, equipment, and resources efficiently.
